sourcing.instructions: B (Boron): Chemical supply companies or online chemical retailers. Mo (Molybdenum): Metal suppliers or online metal distributors. Pa (Palladium): Specialty metal suppliers. Tm (Thulium): Rare earth material suppliers or online marketplaces.
steps: B (Boron): Chemical supply companies or online chemical retailers. Mo (Molybdenum): Metal suppliers or online metal distributors. Pa (Palladium): Specialty metal suppliers. Tm (Thulium): Rare earth material suppliers or online marketplaces.

1. Measure 1200g of Boron using an analytical scale. 2. Measure 300g of Molybdenum. 3. Measure 300g of Palladium. 4. Measure 300g of Thulium. 5. Combine all measured materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mechanical stirrer to mix thoroughly for at least 10 minutes to ensure a homogenous blend.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 1200g of Boron using an analytical scale. 2. Measure 300g of Molybdenum. 3. Measure 300g of Palladium. 4. Measure 300g of Thulium. 5. Combine all measured materials in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mechanical stirrer to mix thoroughly for at least 10 minutes to ensure a homogenous blend.

steps: 1. Preheat a vacuum furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the mixed material into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a vacuum furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the mixed material into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 5 hours). 2. Ensure the atmosphere remains inert during cooling to prevent oxidation.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 5 hours). 2. Ensure the atmosphere remains inert during cooling to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond grinding wheel to sand down the edges and surfaces for a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealing compound if required for the intended application. 4. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
